document_title: Gynecomastia: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
To prevent gynecomastia, men need to pay attention to the following issues:
Limit alcohol use; Regularly practice sports; Limit consumption of estrogen-rich foods such as soybeans, flaxseeds, nuts, etc.; Avoid using medications containing the hormone estrogen; Follow-up appointments as scheduled to monitor symptoms when diagnosed with gynecomastia. Use medication as prescribed by a specialist. Do not stop taking medication on your own.
Gynecomastia is a benign disease, not life-threatening, but that does not mean you can be subjective, because men with gynecomastia have a risk of breast cancer ten times higher than others. Normal. Therefore, when you detect abnormal signs in the mammary glands, you should go to a specialized medical facility for examination and appropriate treatment.
